result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A Wawrzyniec was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay fine of $50 plus costs to include the DNA surcharge.  To be paid during probation according to schedule determined by the agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Provide a DNA sample unless previously done so. 
Participate in any counseling as recommended by the agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew A Wawrzyniec in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:21 a.m.  Court calls the case.  

Court contacts Atty Laufenberg by phone. Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg appeared by phone for Defendant Matthew A Wawrzyniec. 

Court reviews the file.  
Atty Laufenberg makes arguments re: financial committment of the defendant and asks to withdraw from the case. 
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant does not object to Atty Laufenberg withdrawing.  He has received the PSI and reviewed it.  There is no reason he shouldn't be sentenced today. 

Court keeps Atty Laufenberg on the phone in case the defendant has any questions. 

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements. 
Court questions defendant. 

BY THE COURT: 
Serve 270 days jail with huber for going to work.  STAYED
Placed on probation for a period of 18 months:
Pay fine of $50 plus costs to include the DNA surcharge.  To be paid during probation according to schedule determined by agent.
Provide DNA sample unless previously done so. 
100 hours community service.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription 
Maintain fulltime employment.
Participate in any counseling as recommended by the agent. 

Court signs the Order that was submitted by Atty Laufenberg and grants his motion to withdraw.
Sentencing hearing on March 9, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Matthew A Wawrzyniec in court.  Attorney  Wright C. Laufenberg appeared by phone for Defendant Matthew A Wawrzyniec. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Court allowed the attorney to appear by phone today since he filed a motion to withdraw.  On 1/29 the Court received a fax indicating the financial arrangments with the defendant have improved and is withdrawing his motion.  Now needs time so asks for a continuance.  
Atty Laufenberg makes statements to the Court. 

Court orders the Clerk to enter Judgment of Conviction this date as it was not done at the plea hearing. 

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 11:15 am.
From Atty Laufenberg re: telephone appearance - granted
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Sentencing hearing on January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew A Wawrzyniec in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Laufenburg makes statements.  Indicates he was trying to work with an issue with Atty Constable. Was not able to get her before she left.  The defendant would like to adjourn or withhold entry of the judgment to allow for the defendant to deer hunt this last season. 
Atty Cousins does not object. 
  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Count 2 - GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 2.  Clerk directed to withhold the entry of the Judgment of Conviction until the time of sentencing.
Counts 1, 3 & 4 are dismissed and read-in. 

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on November 11, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew A Wawrzyniec in court with attorney Wright C Laufenberg. *ADA Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
